comment: She clearly has a lot of experience in the field she teaches, applies the coursework to real life scenarios- encourages you to think about the concepts in the course. She's very personable, and forgiving on assignment deadlines. A lot of vocab to remember though. Engage! She will think through scenarios and concepts with you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a kind and knowledgeable instructor. However, she sometimes goes off on tangents. Her open-note tests, with a webcam and lockdown browser, are detailed requiring you to basically memorize the textbook. She offers extra credit. Attendance and participation are part of your grade, with pop quizzes making up 20% of your grade.

I did not like her at first but now I do think she is a good professor. I have actually learned a lot. But it is soo much work that she expects from you. And she is a little cookoo. But I will say that I actually would take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: No, just no.

Tremendously unorganized professor, lectures are glorified tangents. Makes a point to focus on teaching us things that "will be useful in real life", but instead just tells stories of her like for over half of the class. Lectures are completely skippable as all the exams come from the textbook (application based, total nightmares), but takes roll.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She's know-legible however gets lots all the time. She makes this class more complicated that would be needed to. She's very heavy on lockdown with camera, gives extra credit however makes it a lot more difficult. Could not handle that.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Think about your worst class in middle school. That's what it's like. She claimed she makes no money being here, yet she still makes the class like it's medical school. Not very lenient at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment:
I've had professors who were challenging yet astute. Those demanding instructors were simply doing their jobs by educating me. I might not have liked them but I respected them.

As much as I wish it weren't the case here, Morris is not one of those educators. On paper she teaches law but in truth her real passions are her ego and self-importance.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: I have never had a professor that I have written a bad review about but her. She says her tests will be textbook based but talks about why she doesn't like the textbook the whole class, and a quiz question we did recently was "What's one thing I did prior to law school". She says she teaches for fun but it might be to pat her ego on the back. :(

She's funny and energetic, but her class is very unorganized. Homework isn't helpful for exams, which are more complex. Lectures are hard to follow due to tangents, and slides aren't useful for studying. No study materials are provided beyond the textbook. Final is cumulative, but no prep is given. pros: there's extra credit and online exams.

She is a super nice teacher that will hear you out, she also doesn't have any lockdown browser on the exams. But she does use proctorio on the final. you'll get about 4 homework assignments due every Sunday. She also takes attendance as a grade but she honestly makes class really enjoyable.
she is awesome. Anyone who wants a free GPA boost definitely needs to take this class.

Funny professor, slides and lectures were not helpful at all for studying and she never posts study guides. Exams are online without lockdown browser. Must read the textbook. Basically your only studying option. Lots of extra credit opportunities. attendance is mandatory and she does also grade for participation. final is cumulative.

Nice lady and super funny however the grading criteria were unclear up until the final. She ended up being very generous with attendance but it was still mandatory and important. She will make you participate so get ready to talk. No huge writing assignments though which was nice.

Very passionate and probably amazing for business law students but her lectures are both random and poorly paced. She has a tendency to get really distracted and hold people after lectures have ended. She also is super sensitive so if you do take her try not to damage her ego in any way. I wouldn't recommend taking her unless you have to.

TAKE HER !!! She offers SO much extra credit and participation points, she WANTS you to learn and succeed. She is so funny, so laid back and easy going. Yes you have to read but she makes it fun. Easy class if you just read the book !!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved Prof. Morris. I took her over in the Fall of '23, and she was hilarious and down to earth; she had entertaining stories to share about her experience, and I looked forward to every class. Exams are open note and no lockdown, lots of extra credit.
Horrible professor, does not care even a little bit about her students or their success. Unprofessional and childish. If you want a mature professor, take someone else.
"SOOO MUCH extra credit." Up to seven absences allowed before any points taken off for attendance. Lectures are always fun and entertaining. Open note. Average workload.

Good professor in what she teaches (I mean she is a lawyer), however extremely immature. Has a mouth like a sailor, once said F you to my face because I didn't participate enough in class. Attendance mandatory, she doesn't care if you miss class because you want to skip or are hospitalized, she'll count it against you.

This professor is great. She gives lots of extra credit and there is no homework. She does require a lot of participation and attendance, but it's not hard. She is very lecture heavy, you really don't do anything in class but lectures, but if you listen and read you should be a stellar student. I never read and still did great in this class.

Great Professor that has actual experience with the law. She is a lawyer and knows her stuff. Also, she is a very funny lady that can get off topic sometimes but class is always fun and if you go to class you will pass the tests.

Mary Morris will keep you interested in the material. She does great lectures and is a lawyer by trade. Pay attention to the little metaphors she uses as they will become bonus questions on the test. She is very approachable and will help you so long as you ask.

This professor means the world to me. She's super nice and caring. She helped me with an honors credit that I really needed and allowed me to do a project for her when I only asked her 2 days in advance. Tests are long (sometimes 100+ questions) but as long as you listen in class you'll know the answers. Also, all HW is extra Credit, Not required.
Great professor, extra credit is offered at the end of the semester. The final is accumulative test and if you like anything involving the topic of Law then you will enjoy the lectures.

I loved professor Morris! She made her lectures interesting and incorporated real world examples. She is also very great when I comes to extra credit opportunities. Would recommend taking her if you have the chance, made blaw enjoyable.

Made all the homework assignments extra credit and had one test have extra credit. Funny and is a lawyer so she knows the material. Tests are open note and textbook. Grades consist of 4 tests and extra credit. Mid-term and final are cumulative. Tests are based on in class lectures posted online and textbook.
